ground_truth: The men in the boat wear burnt orange robes and have shaved heads. The boat's motor churns up plumes of white foam on the river as Rambo steers at the tiller. The boat enters more populated territories, where there are wooden homes on the riverside and harbors made of timber. A building on the riverside features a sign with a large painting of a cobra on the wall and a Red Cross sign. The boat pulls in at a harbor where two men stop what they're doing and turn their attention to the boat: one man wears a white t-shirt and a black hat, the other a blue shirt and a bandanna. The boat slows to a halt as Rambo and his men disembark, with Rambo bearing a doleful and weary expression. The sun casts an orange glow on the river water. Surrounded by onlookers, a young snake-charmer crouches alone in an open area facing two cobras, one of which rears and strikes at the dark-haired wrangler. A snake merchant approaches Rambo and gives him cash, while Rambo's men are nearby. Rambo walks away in disgust, heads for the perimeter of the arena, and empties a bag containing the cobra into a wooden crate. A group of Westerners arrive, led by Michael, who has thinning hair, and a blonde girl, Sarah. Michael greets and talks to the merchant, who points to Rambo, as Rambo maneuvers a cobra into the crate and slams down the lid. In the arena, the wrangler teases a cobra while Rambo stands near wire and wood snake cages as Michael and his party approach. Rambo throws a rat into one of the cages and scratches his face idly. Michael seems temporarily lost for words, and Rambo leaves. Michael turns to his party, and Sarah, who is in her mid-20s, pretty with blonde, scraggly hair and a high forehead, follows Rambo out. Rambo is washing his face and hair in a water barrel, then picks up a towel, wipes his face, and hangs the towel on a hook. He walks up to Sarah and fixes her with a firm stare before walking away. He toils alone in a darkened workshop where the only light comes from sunlight outside and the flames of the fire. Using a hammer, he forges a piece of broken steel on an anvil, its end orange and white with heat, then wipes an arm across his sweaty brow as his blows on the steel become more intense. In the darkness, save for the glow of headlights on jeeps and beams from hand torches, the army drags people from their homes and marches them away at gunpoint under the supervision of the cigarette-smoking commander.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The males in the vessel sport burnt sienna garments and have shaved crowns. The vessel's engine churns up plumes of alabaster froth on the river as Rambo pilots at the helm. The vessel enters more inhabited regions, where there are wooden dwellings on the riverside and docks made of timber. A structure on the riverside exhibits a placard with a large depiction of a serpent on the wall and a Red Cross emblem. The vessel pulls in at a dock where two males cease what they're doing and turn their focus to the vessel: one male wears a white t-shirt and a black cap, the other a blue shirt and a kerchief. The vessel slows to a stop as Rambo and his males disembark, with Rambo bearing a sorrowful and fatigued demeanor. The sun casts an orange radiance on the river liquid. Encircled by spectators, a young snake-charmer crouches alone in an open area facing two serpents, one of which rears and lunges at the dark-haired wrangler. A snake vendor approaches Rambo and hands him money, while Rambo's males are nearby. Rambo strides away in disgust, heads for the boundary of the arena, and empties a bag containing the serpent into a wooden box. A group of Westerners arrive, led by Michael, who has thinning locks, and a flaxen girl, Sarah. Michael greets and converses with the vendor, who directs to Rambo, as Rambo maneuvers a serpent into the box and slams down the cover. In the arena, the wrangler taunts a serpent while Rambo stands near wire and wood serpent enclosures as Michael and his party approach. Rambo tosses a rodent into one of the enclosures and scratches his visage idly. Michael seems temporarily at a loss for words, and Rambo departs. Michael turns to his party, and Sarah, who is in her mid-20s, attractive with flaxen, scruffy locks and a high brow, follows Rambo out. Rambo is washing his visage and locks in a water barrel, then picks up a towel, wipes his visage, and hangs the towel on a peg. He walks up to Sarah and fixes her with a firm gaze before striding away. He labors alone in a dimmed workshop where the only illumination comes from sunlight outside and the flames of the fire. Using a mallet, he shapes a piece of broken steel on an anvil, its end orange and white with heat, then wipes an arm across his sweaty forehead as his strikes on the steel become more vigorous. In the darkness, save for the radiance of headlights on jeeps and beams from hand lamps, the military drags individuals from their dwellings and marches them away at gunpoint under the supervision of the cigarette-smoking commander.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The burnt orange robes are worn by the men in the boat, and their heads have been shaved. White foam plumes are churned up by the boat's motor on the river as the tiller is steered by Rambo. More populated territories are entered by the boat, where wooden homes are on the riverside and harbors made of timber exist. A sign with a large painting of a cobra and a Red Cross sign features on a building on the riverside. The boat is pulled in at a harbor where two men stop what they're doing and turn their attention to it: a white t-shirt and a black hat are worn by one man, and a blue shirt and a bandanna by the other. The boat is slowed to a halt as Rambo and his men disembark, with a doleful and weary expression borne by Rambo. An orange glow is cast on the river water by the sun. Surrounded by onlookers, two cobras are faced by a young snake-charmer who crouches alone in an open area, and one of which rears and strikes at the dark-haired wrangler. Rambo is approached by a snake merchant and cash is given to him, while Rambo's men are nearby. Disgusted, Rambo walks away, heads for the perimeter of the arena, and a bag containing the cobra is emptied by him into a wooden crate. A group of Westerners arrives, led by Michael, who has thinning hair, and Sarah, a blonde girl. Michael greets and talks to the merchant, who points to Rambo, as a cobra is maneuvered by Rambo into the crate and the lid is slammed down. In the arena, a cobra is teased by the wrangler while Rambo stands near wire and wood snake cages as Michael and his party approach. A rat is thrown by Rambo into one of the cages, and his face is scratched idly by him. Temporarily lost for words, Michael turns to his party, and Sarah, who is in her mid-20s, pretty with blonde, scraggly hair and a high forehead, follows Rambo out. Rambo's face and hair are washed by him in a water barrel, then a towel is picked up, and his face is wiped before the towel is hung on a hook. He fixes Sarah with a firm stare before walking away. Alone, Rambo toils in a darkened workshop where the only light comes from the sunlight outside and the flames of the fire. Using a hammer, a piece of broken steel is forged by him on an anvil, its end orange and white with heat, and an arm is wiped across his sweaty brow as his blows on the steel become more intense. In the darkness, save for the glow of headlights on jeeps and beams from hand torches, people are dragged from their homes by the army and marched away at gunpoint under the supervision of the cigarette-smoking commander.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Men wearing burnt orange robes and shaved heads are in a boat steered by Rambo, stirring white foam on the river. As they move into populated areas, wooden riverside homes and timber harbors appear. A building with a cobra painting and Red Cross sign is visible. The boat docks at a harbor where two men—a man in a white t-shirt with a black hat and another in a blue shirt with a bandanna—watch. Rambo and his men disembark, Rambo looking worn out, as the sun casts an orange glow on the river. Surrounded by onlookers, a young snake-charmer faces two cobras, one striking at him. A snake merchant pays Rambo, who disgustedly walks away, empties a cobra into a wooden crate, and leaves. Michael, with thinning hair, and Sarah, a blonde girl, arrive with Westerners. Michael talks to the merchant, who points to Rambo handling a cobra. Rambo stands by snake cages as Michael and his group approach. Rambo throws a rat into a cage, scratches his face, and exits. Michael hesitates, and Sarah, in her mid-20s with scraggly blonde hair and high forehead, follows Rambo. He washes in a water barrel, uses a towel, and then stares firmly at Sarah before leaving. Alone in a dark workshop lit by sunlight and fire, Rambo forges heated steel on an anvil, wiping sweat as he works intensely. In the night, illuminated by jeep headlights and torches, the army forcibly removes people from homes under a smoking commander’s supervision.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description:
Men in burnt orange robes with shaved heads are in a boat, steered by Rambo. The motor creates white foam as they enter populated areas with wooden riverside homes and timber harbors. They stop at a harbor where two men, wearing distinct hats and shirts, notice them. Rambo disembarks, looking weary under the sun's orange glow on the river. 

A young snake-charmer entertains onlookers while a snake merchant gives Rambo cash. Upset, Rambo puts a cobra in a crate. A Western group, led by Michael and Sarah, arrives. Michael speaks to the merchant, who points to Rambo managing the cobra. The wrangler teases a snake while Rambo observes. Michael hesitates, and Rambo departs as Sarah follows. Rambo washes up, exchanges a stare with Sarah, and leaves.

In his dim workshop, lit only by sunlight and fire, Rambo hammers steel on an anvil, intensifying his blows. At night, the army, led by a commander, drags people from homes at gunpoint, using jeep headlights and torches to navigate.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The individuals seated in the boat are wearing robes of a deep burnt orange hue, and their heads are completely shaved, adding to their distinctive appearance. The motor of the boat churns vigorously, creating plentiful plumes of white foam that dance atop the surface of the river as Rambo, with steady hands, skillfully steers from the tiller. As the boat continues its journey, it enters areas that gradually become more populated and lively, showing wooden homes that stand proudly along the riverside, alongside harbors that have been constructed from timber. One particular building on the riverbank draws attention due to a sign that prominently displays a large, carefully painted image of a cobra on the wall, along with a symbol indicating a Red Cross. As the boat draws near and eventually pulls into the harbor, two men, who had been immersed in their tasks, pause and redirect their focus toward the arriving boat: one is dressed in a simple white t-shirt and a black hat, while the other sports a blue shirt paired with a bandanna. The boat gradually slows to a halt, and the moment arrives for Rambo and his men to disembark, with Rambo himself bearing a deeply doleful and weary look on his face. Meanwhile, the sun casts a beautiful orange glow over the river's surface. 

As they reach land and find themselves surrounded by curious onlookers, a young snake-charmer is spotted crouching alone in an open area, his focus on two cobras; one of these snakes rears back and suddenly strikes at the dark-haired wrangler. Nearby, a snake merchant catches sight of Rambo and approaches with a purposeful stride, handing over cash, while Rambo's men stay close by. However, Rambo, overcome with disgust, walks away from the scene and heads determinedly for the perimeter of the arena. There, he empties a bag that contains a cobra into a wooden crate with deliberate movements. It is at this moment that a group of Westerners arrives, their presence led by a man named Michael, whose hair is noticeably thinning, and a young blonde woman named Sarah. Michael initiates a conversation with the merchant, who gestures toward Rambo, as Rambo expertly maneuvers the cobra into the crate and firmly slams down the lid. In the arena, the wrangler continues to tease a cobra, while Rambo stands near cages made of wire and wood as Michael and his party make their approach. Rambo, in a moment of distraction, throws a rat into one of the cages and scratches his face in an idle manner. 

Michael appears temporarily lost for words, causing a pause, during which Rambo quietly departs. Michael then turns toward his group, and Sarah, who is in her mid-20s, with pretty features complemented by her blonde, slightly scraggly hair and a high forehead, decides to follow Rambo outside. Rambo, finding a moment of solitude, washes his face and hair in a water barrel, then picks up a towel, wipes his face thoroughly, and hangs the towel neatly on a hook. He approaches Sarah and fixes her with a firm, unwavering stare before turning away to leave. Alone once more, he toils in a dimly lit workshop where the only sources of light are the sunshine filtering in from outside and the flames flickering from the fire. Using a hammer, he diligently forges a piece of broken steel on an anvil; its edges glow a striking orange and white from the intense heat. He wipes an arm across his sweaty forehead as the force of his hammer blows on the steel increases, becoming more intense. Meanwhile, shrouded in darkness, save for the glow of headlights from jeeps and the beams emitted from hand torches, the army systematically drags people from the safety of their homes, marching them away at gunpoint under the keen supervision of a cigarette-smoking commander.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The individuals who are currently seated in the boat are dressed in robes that possess a rich, deep burnt orange hue, setting them apart with their unique and distinctive appearance. Their heads are completely shaved, which only adds to their overall intriguing look. The motor of the boat churns with great vigor, creating numerous plumes of white foam that dance energetically atop the surface of the river. Meanwhile, Rambo, with steady and practiced hands, skillfully steers from the tiller, guiding the boat with precision. As the boat continues its journey along the river, it gradually enters areas that become more densely populated and lively. These areas showcase wooden homes that stand proudly along the riverside, alongside harbors that have been constructed from robust timber, adding to the rustic charm of the scene. One particular building on the riverbank captures attention due to a sign that prominently displays a large and carefully painted image of a cobra on the wall. Additionally, there is a symbol indicating a Red Cross. As the boat draws nearer and eventually pulls into the harbor, two men, who had been deeply immersed in their tasks, pause and redirect their focus toward the approaching boat. One of these men is dressed in a simple white t-shirt and a black hat, while the other sports a blue shirt paired with a bandanna. As the boat gradually slows to a halt, the moment finally arrives for Rambo and his men to disembark, with Rambo himself bearing a deeply doleful and weary look on his face. Meanwhile, the sun, in all its glory, casts a beautiful orange glow over the surface of the river.

Upon reaching land and finding themselves surrounded by curious onlookers, a young snake-charmer is spotted crouching alone in an open area, his full attention focused on two cobras; one of these snakes rears back and suddenly strikes at the dark-haired wrangler. Nearby, a snake merchant catches sight of Rambo and approaches him with a purposeful stride, handing over a sum of cash, while Rambo's men remain close by, vigilant and observant. However, Rambo, overcome with disgust, decides to walk away from the scene, heading determinedly for the perimeter of the arena. There, with deliberate and careful movements, he empties a bag that contains a cobra into a wooden crate. It is precisely at this moment that a group of Westerners arrives, their presence led by a man named Michael, whose hair is noticeably thinning, and accompanied by a young blonde woman named Sarah. Michael initiates a conversation with the merchant, who gestures toward Rambo. Meanwhile, Rambo expertly maneuvers the cobra into the crate and firmly slams down the lid with a sense of finality. In the arena, the wrangler continues to tease a cobra, maintaining the tension, while Rambo stands near cages made of wire and wood as Michael and his accompanying party make their gradual approach. In a momentary distraction, Rambo throws a rat into one of the cages and absentmindedly scratches his face.

Michael appears temporarily lost for words, causing an awkward pause during which Rambo quietly departs from the gathering. Michael then turns toward his group, and Sarah, who is in her mid-20s, with pretty features complemented by her slightly scraggly blonde hair and a high forehead, decides to follow Rambo outside. Finding a fleeting moment of solitude, Rambo washes his face and hair in a water barrel, then picks up a towel, wiping his face thoroughly before hanging the towel neatly on a hook. Approaching Sarah, he fixes her with a firm, unwavering stare, before resolutely turning away to leave. Once alone again, he toils away in a dimly lit workshop where the only sources of light are the bright sunshine filtering in from outside and the flickering flames from the fire. Using a hammer, he diligently forges a piece of broken steel on an anvil, its edges glowing with a striking orange and white from the intense heat. He wipes an arm across his sweaty forehead as the force of his hammer blows on the steel becomes more intense and powerful. Meanwhile, in stark contrast, a scene shrouded in darkness unfolds. Save for the glow of headlights coming from jeeps and the beams emitted from hand torches, the army systematically drags people from the safety of their homes, marching them away at gunpoint under the keen and watchful supervision of a cigarette-smoking commander.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The men in the boat are dressed in burnt orange robes, and their heads are completely shaved, indicating a distinct appearance that immediately draws attention. As Rambo takes firm control of the tiller, the boat's powerful motor roars to life, churning up plumes of frothy white foam that dance across the river's surface, marking their swift passage. The boat glides smoothly into more populated territories, revealing a landscape dotted with wooden homes that line the riverside, their rustic structures interspersed with timber harbors that jut out into the water. As they continue, they pass by a prominent riverside building, its wall adorned with a large, striking painting of a cobra alongside a Red Cross sign, which signals its significance. Bringing the boat into a gradual stop, Rambo docks at a nearby harbor, drawing the attention of two men who immediately cease their activities. The first man is casually dressed in a white t-shirt and sports a black hat, while the second wears a blue shirt complemented by a bandanna. As the boat comes to a gentle halt, Rambo, with a doleful and weary expression etched onto his face, along with his men, begins to disembark. The sun hangs low in the sky, casting a warm orange glow that reflects off the river water, creating a serene yet poignant atmosphere. In an open area nearby, a young snake-charmer, surrounded by curious onlookers, crouches alone, intently facing two cobras. One of these serpents suddenly rears and strikes at the dark-haired wrangler, adding a sense of danger to the display. Amidst this scene, a snake merchant approaches Rambo and quietly hands over cash to him, while Rambo's men linger close by. Rambo, visibly disgusted, quickly turns away, making his way toward the arena's perimeter, where he finds a wooden crate into which he empties a bag containing a cobra. Meanwhile, a group of Westerners arrives on the scene, led by Michael, a man with thinning hair, and accompanied by Sarah, a young blonde girl. Michael steps forward to greet and engage in conversation with the merchant, who responds by pointing toward Rambo. At that moment, Rambo is in the process of coercing a cobra into the crate, after which he decisively slams the lid shut. Inside the arena, the wrangler continues to tease one of the cobras while Rambo stands watchfully nearby, positioned close to cages constructed from wire and wood, observing as Michael and his party approach. In a swift, practiced motion, Rambo tosses a rat into one of these cages and idly scratches his face, lost in thought. Michael, momentarily at a loss for words, watches as Rambo turns and leaves the scene. Michael then shifts his attention back to his party, and Sarah, who is in her mid-20s, with pretty, blonde, scraggly hair and a high forehead, follows Rambo as he walks away. Rambo finds a moment of solitude to wash his face and hair in a water barrel, the cool liquid refreshing against his skin. Afterward, he picks up a towel, wiping his face dry before methodically hanging the towel on a nearby hook. He approaches Sarah, fixes her with a firm, penetrating stare, and then without a word, walks away, intent on his work. Alone in a dimly lit workshop, where the only sources of light are the sunlight filtering from outside and the warm glow from the flames of the fire, Rambo focuses intensely on his craft. Using a hammer, he begins to forge a piece of broken steel on an anvil, its end glowing orange and white with heat. As he works, he pauses to wipe the sweat from his brow with his arm, then continues with renewed vigor, the intensity of his blows increasing with each strike. Outside, enveloped in the darkness, illuminated only by the piercing glow of jeep headlights and the narrow beams of hand torches, the army is in forceful motion. Soldiers drag people from their homes, herding them away at gunpoint, all under the watchful eye of a cigarette-smoking commander who oversees the operation with a steely resolve.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The men in the boat, wearing burnt orange robes and with shaved heads, travel along a river as Rambo steers, creating white foam with the motor. As they enter more populated areas with wooden riverside homes and timber harbors, they pass a building featuring a large cobra painting and a Red Cross sign. Upon arriving at a harbor, they catch the attention of two men, who stop their activities to watch the docking boat. Rambo and his men disembark, his expression weary, as the sun casts an orange glow on the water. Amidst onlookers, a young snake-charmer faces two cobras, and a snake merchant pays Rambo. Disgusted, Rambo walks to the arena's perimeter and transfers a cobra into a wooden crate. Meanwhile, Michael and a group of Westerners, including Sarah, approach. Michael converses with the merchant, who points to Rambo as he secures the cobra crate. Rambo, standing by snake cages, idly throws a rat into one and scratches his face while Michael seems at a loss for words. Ignoring further interaction, Rambo leaves, followed by Sarah. After washing his face and hair, Rambo towels off and gives Sarah a firm stare before moving on to work alone in a dimly lit workshop. There, he forges heated steel on an anvil, wiping his sweaty brow as his hammering intensifies. In the night, soldiers, overseen by a cigarette-smoking commander, forcibly remove people from their homes at gunpoint, illuminated by jeep headlights and hand torches.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The men in the boat wear burnt orange robes and have shaved heads, resembling Buddhist monks known for such attire symbolizing renunciation and humility. The boat's motor churns up plumes of white foam on the river, a major tributary teeming with life, as Rambo, a seasoned guide renowned in the area for his knowledge of local waterways, steers at the tiller. The boat enters more populated territories along the Mekong River, where there are wooden homes on the riverside built on stilts to withstand seasonal floods and harbors made of timber. A building on the riverside, a makeshift clinic for treating snake bites, features a sign with a large painting of a cobra on the wall and a Red Cross sign, indicating a place of medical assistance. The boat pulls in at a harbor where two men stop what they're doing and turn their attention to the boat: one man wears a white t-shirt and a black hat, typically worn to shield from the intense sun, the other a blue shirt and a bandanna, often used to wipe away sweat in the humid climate. The boat slows to a halt as Rambo and his men disembark, with Rambo bearing a doleful and weary expression from his recent encounters with the harsh realities of the area. The sun casts an orange glow on the river water, a daily spectacle in this tropical region. Surrounded by onlookers, a young snake-charmer crouches alone in an open area facing two cobras, one of which rears and strikes at the dark-haired wrangler, displaying the traditional yet dangerous entertainment rooted in local folklore. A snake merchant approaches Rambo, who has a reputation for dealing with various vendors in the area, and gives him cash, while Rambo's men are nearby, vigilant as they assist in the transaction. Rambo walks away in disgust, heads for the perimeter of the arena, and empties a bag containing the cobra into a wooden crate, expressing his disdain for the exploitative trade. A group of Westerners arrive, led by Michael, who has thinning hair and is a humanitarian worker known for his frequent travels, and a blonde girl, Sarah, whose background in social work brings her to these challenging environments. Michael greets and talks to the merchant, who points to Rambo, as Rambo maneuvers a cobra into the crate and slams down the lid with frustration. In the arena, the wrangler teases a cobra, adhering to a craft passed down through generations, while Rambo stands near wire and wood snake cages as Michael and his party approach. Rambo throws a rat into one of the cages, an essential part of feeding the captive reptiles, and scratches his face idly, lost in thought. Michael seems temporarily lost for words, his sympathy for the people evident, and Rambo leaves, weary of the surrounding chaos. Michael turns to his party, and Sarah, who is in her mid-20s, pretty with blonde, scraggly hair and a high forehead, follows Rambo out, intrigued by his stoic demeanor. Rambo is washing his face and hair in a water barrel, the only source of refreshment in the sweltering heat, then picks up a towel, wipes his face, and hangs the towel on a hook. He walks up to Sarah and fixes her with a firm stare, reflecting his guarded nature, before walking away. He toils alone in a darkened workshop where the only light comes from sunlight outside and the flames of the fire, reminiscent of a blacksmith's forge. Using a hammer, he forges a piece of broken steel on an anvil, its end orange and white with heat, then wipes an arm across his sweaty brow as his blows on the steel become more intense, finding solace in physical labor. In the darkness, save for the glow of headlights on jeeps and beams from hand torches, the army drags people from their homes in a cruel exercise of power and marches them away at gunpoint under the supervision of the cigarette-smoking commander, notorious for his ruthless reputation.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The men in the boat wear burnt orange robes and have shaved heads. The boat's motor churns up plumes of white foam on the river as Rambo steers at the tiller. The boat enters more populated territories where there are wooden homes on the riverside and harbors made of timber. A building on the riverside features a sign with a large painting of a cobra on the wall and a Red Cross sign. The boat pulls in at a harbor where two men stop what they are doing and turn their attention to the boat. one man wears a white tshirt and a black hat the other a blue shirt and a bandanna. The boat slows to a halt as Rambo and his men disembark with Rambo bearing a doleful and weary expression. The sun casts an orange glow on the river water. Surrounded by onlookers a young snakecharmer crouches alone in an open area facing two cobras one of which rears and strikes at the darkhaired wrangler. A snake merchant approaches Rambo and gives him cash while Rambo's men are nearby. Rambo walks away in disgust heads for the perimeter of the arena and empties a bag containing the cobra into a wooden crate. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. A group of Westerners arrive led by Michael who has thinning hair and a blonde girl Sarah. Michael greets and talks to the merchant who points to Rambo as Rambo maneuvers a cobra into the crate and slams down the lid. In the arena the wrangler teases a cobra while Rambo stands near wire and wood snake cages as Michael and his party approach. Rambo throws a rat into one of the cages and scratches his face idly. Michael seems temporarily lost for words and Rambo leaves. Michael turns to his party and Sarah who is in her mid20s pretty with blonde scraggly hair and a high forehead follows Rambo out. Rambo is washing his face and hair in a water barrel then picks up a towel wipes his face and hangs the towel on a hook. He walks up to Sarah and fixes her with a firm stare before walking away. He toils alone in a darkened workshop where the only light comes from sunlight outside and the flames of the fire. Using a hammer he forges a piece of broken steel on an anvil its end orange and white with heat then wipes an arm across his sweaty brow as his blows on the steel become more intense. In the darkness save for the glow of headlights on jeeps and beams from hand torches. the army drags people from their homes and marches them away at gunpoint under the supervision of the cigarettesmoking commander.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. A group of Westerners arrive led by Michael who has thinning hair and a blonde girl Sarah. Michael greets and talks to the merchant who points to Rambo as Rambo maneuvers a cobra into the crate and slams down the lid. In the arena the wrangler teases a cobra while Rambo stands near wire and wood snake cages as Michael and his party approach. Rambo throws a rat into one of the cages and scratches his face idly. Michael seems temporarily lost for words and Rambo leaves. Michael turns to his party and Sarah who is in her mid20s pretty with blonde scraggly hair and a high forehead follows Rambo out. Rambo is washing his face and hair in a water barrel then picks up a towel wipes his face and hangs the towel on a hook. He walks up to Sarah and fixes her with a firm stare before walking away. He toils alone in a darkened workshop where the only light comes from sunlight outside and the flames of the fire. Using a hammer he forges a piece of broken steel on an anvil its end orange and white with heat then wipes an arm across his sweaty brow as his blows on the steel become more intense. In the darkness save for the glow of headlights on jeeps and beams from hand torches. the army drags people from their homes and marches them away at gunpoint under the supervision of the cigarettesmoking commander.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The men in the boat wear burnt orange robes and have shaved heads. The boat's motor churns up plumes of white foam on the river as Rambo steers at the tiller. The boat enters more populated territories where there are wooden homes on the riverside and harbors made of timber. A building on the riverside features a sign with a large painting of a cobra on the wall and a Red Cross sign. The boat pulls in at a harbor where two men stop what they are doing and turn their attention to the boat. one man wears a white tshirt and a black hat the other a blue shirt and a bandanna. Rambo is washing his face and hair in a water barrel then picks up a towel wipes his face and hangs the towel on a hook. He walks up to Sarah and fixes her with a firm stare before walking away. He toils alone in a darkened workshop where the only light comes from sunlight outside and the flames of the fire. Using a hammer he forges a piece of broken steel on an anvil its end orange and white with heat then wipes an arm across his sweaty brow as his blows on the steel become more intense. In the darkness save for the glow of headlights on jeeps and beams from hand torches. the army drags people from their homes and marches them away at gunpoint under the supervision of the cigarettesmoking commander.

Using a hammer he forges a piece of broken steel on an anvil its end orange and white with heat then wipes an arm across his sweaty brow as his blows on the steel become more intense. In the darkness save for the glow of headlights on jeeps and beams from hand torches. the army drags people from their homes and marches them away at gunpoint under the supervision of the cigarettesmoking commander.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cats on the bridge don emerald green jackets and have feathered tails. The bridge's engine tosses up waves of red dust on the ocean as Rex dances at the helm. The bridge traverses less crowded landscapes, where there are stone castles on the mountainside and docks made of brick. A tower on the mountainside displays a banner with a large sketch of a rabbit on the tower and a Blue Shield emblem. The bridge docks at a pier where two cats halt what they're knitting and swivel their interest to the bridge: one cat dons a green sweater and a red cap, the other a yellow coat and a scarf. The bridge quickens to a stop as Rex and his cats leap off, with Rex carrying a joyful and energetic demeanor. The moon casts a blue glow on the ocean surface. Encircled by observers, a small illusionist sits alone in a closed space facing two seals, one of which jumps and nips at the blonde juggler. A trinket vendor approaches Rex and hands him jewels, while Rex's cats are beside. Rex skips away in glee, aims for the center of the stage, and fills a net carrying the rabbit into a glass basket. A troupe of Easterners arrive, led by Harold, who has curly fur, and a red-haired girl, Lisa. Harold shakes hands and chats with the vendor, who gestures to Rex, as Rex nudges a rabbit into the basket and flings down the cover. On the stage, the juggler waves a rabbit while Rex stands near metal and stone rabbit pens as Harold and his team draw near. Rex tosses a muffin into one of the pens and taps his elbow idly. Harold appears momentarily full of ideas, and Rex departs. Harold turns to his team, and Lisa, who is in her late 30s, charming with red, frizzy fur and a low chin, trails Rex out. Rex is drying his feet and fur in a wind tunnel, then grabs a blanket, pats his feet, and hangs the blanket on a ledge. He leaps up to Lisa and rewards her with a gentle smile before skipping away. He relaxes alone in a brightened greenhouse where the only dark comes from stars outside and the shadows of the clouds. Using a wrench, he constructs a piece of polished clay on a bench, its tip blue and yellow with light, then wipes a leg across his sandy knee as his taps on the clay become more gentle. In the brightness, save for the flash of candles on carts and rays from desk lamps, the crew hugs monkeys from their burrows and leads them inside at knifepoint under the direction of the candy-chewing gardener.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The men in orange robes with shaved heads are in a boat steered by Rambo on a river, entering areas with riverside homes and a building displaying a cobra painting and Red Cross sign. They stop at a harbor where two men notice them. Rambo and his men disembark as the sun casts an orange glow. Onlookers watch a snake-charmer face striking cobras. A snake merchant pays Rambo, who disdainfully leaves to place a cobra into a crate. Westerners, led by Michael and Sarah, arrive. Michael talks to the merchant who points to Rambo managing a cobra. Rambo, near snake cages, idly throws a rat in and leaves. Sarah follows Rambo, who washes and stares firmly before walking away. He works alone in a workshop, forging steel with intense blows under dim light. At night, the army forcibly removes people from their homes, led by a commander smoking a cigarette.
